page.title: 04THE CHURCH E.WORLINGTON
page.content: East Worlington Church is called St. Marys and we think it dates back to Norman times. There is still a Norman arch and window.Just over a hundred years ago it was rebuilt by Lord Portsmouth.The school house was once a church house which also belonged to Lord Portsmouth.The first rector was Robert de Hendeville in 1261.There have been 46 rectors since then.The last rector to live in the rectory left in 1958.The rector now is Mr Hudson. He lives in Witheridge and we share him with West Worlington, Creacombe,Meshaw, Witheridge and Thelbridge.We have Holy Communion in the church once a month and Morning Prayer every fifth Sunday in the month.The church wardens are Mr.R.Sowden and Mr.G.Boyles. .
